tier.item: `I shall dive for it.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:14)

`They went on digging.' (Mono Alu - Wheeler 1926: text 29)
(7) a. ta-tai sa-na sa-na kanega taro-na
`She kept on weeping for her husband.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:40)

`Women are frightened of snakes.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1988:250)
`Women are frightened of snakes.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1988:250)
(42) a. ir-i-gagana. ir-i-nau. gagana sa-ria, ir-i-soku hauroho
`They went (on their way). They went. Having travelled, [ie. They were travelling and]
they reached the Hauroho river.' (Mono Alu ­ Ross 1982:38)

They went (on their way). They went. Having travelled, [ie. They were travelling and] they reached the Hauroho river.
`His mother and father wailed for him.
`His mother and father wailed for him.
His mother and father wailed for him.
As they wailed [ie. They wailed and] night came on.' (Mono Alu - Wheeler 1926: text 29)
As they wailed [ie. They wailed and] night came on.' (Mono Alu - Wheeler 1926: text 29)
As they wailed [ie. They wailed and] night came on.
His sister stayed on the shore.
`While you stay here, I shall dive for it.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:15/39)
`While you stay here, I shall dive for it.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:15/39)
While you stay here, I shall dive for it.
`As you travel on, you will see the men's gardens.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:39)
`As you travel on, you will see the men's gardens.' (Mono Alu - Ross 1982:39)
As you travel on, you will see the men's gardens.
